git.commitMessage:
fix: Resolve TypeScript build errors in DebugInfo component

Fixed TypeScript compilation errors that were blocking Railway deployment:

Issues Fixed:
1. TS2307: Cannot find module '../buildInfo.json'
   - Created buildInfo.json with default values (committed to repo)
   - Created buildInfo.default.json as template
   - Build process now updates buildInfo.json (no longer gitignored)

2. TS7006: Implicit 'any' type errors in map function
   - Added explicit type annotations: (todo: string, index: number)
   - Ensures strict TypeScript compliance

3. TS6133: Unused type import
   - Removed unused BuildInfo type import
   - TypeScript infers type from JSON import automatically

Changes:
- Created frontend/src/types/buildInfo.ts (type definitions)
- Created frontend/src/buildInfo.default.json (template)
- Created frontend/src/buildInfo.json (default state, updated by build)
- Updated .gitignore (removed buildInfo.json exclusion)
- Fixed DebugInfo.tsx type annotations

Build Process:
- buildInfo.json now committed with defaults
- Build script overwrites with real git info
- No more missing module errors on fresh installs
- TypeScript strict mode compliance maintained

âœ… Build verified: Both frontend and backend compile successfully
âœ… Railway deployment should now succeed
